00077 class MovieInfo

00079         public:
00080                 char *Name; // yes, only that
00081                 static DynamicVectorClass<MovieInfo> *Array;
00082 
00083         bool operator== (MovieInfo &rhs)
00084                 { return !strcmp(rhs.Name, this->Name); }
00085 
00086         MovieInfo(const char *fname)
00087                 { this->Name = _strdup(fname); }
00088

00090                 {}
00091 
00092         ~MovieInfo()
00093                 { delete this->Name; }

00208 /*
00209  * This thing is ridiculous
00210  * all xxTypeClass::Create functions use it:
00211 
00212   InfantryTypeClass *foo = something;
00213   ++SomeMutex;
00214   InfantryClass *obj = something->CreateObject();
00215   --SomeMutex;
00216 
00217   ++SomeMutex;
00218   obj->Put(blah);
00219   --SomeMutex;
00220   
00221   AI base node generation uses it:
00222   int level = SomeMutex;
00223   SomeMutex = 0;
00224   House->GenerateAIBuildList();
00225   SomeMutex = level;
00226   
00227   Building destruction uses it:
00228   if(!SomeMutex) {
00229         Building->ShutdownSensorArray();
00230         Building->ShutdownDisguiseSensor();
00231   }
00232   
00233   Building placement uses it:
00234   if(!SomeMutex) {
00235         UnitTypeClass *freebie = Building->Type->FreeUnit;
00236         if(freebie) {
00237                 freebie->CreateObject(blah);
00238         }
00239   }
00240   
00241   Building state animations use it:
00242   if(SomeMutex) {
00243         // foreach attached anim
00244         // update anim state (normal | damaged | garrisoned) if necessary, play anim
00245   }
00246   
00247   building selling uses it:
00248   if(blah) {
00249         ++SomeMutex;
00250         this->Type->UndeploysInto->CreateAtMapCoords(blah);
00251         --SomeMutex;
00252   }
00253 
00254   Robot Control Centers use it:
00255   if ( !SomeMutex ) {
00256         VoxClass::PlayFromName("EVA_RobotTanksOffline/BackOnline", -1, -1);
00257   }
00258 
00259   and so on...
00260  */
